official-title.#text:
To provide for the establishment of the Local Food for
		  Healthy Families Program.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail:
,
			 and in addition to the Committee on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the
			 Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the
			 jurisdiction of the committee concerned

short-title.#text:
Local Food for Healthy Families Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Local Food for
			 Healthy Families Program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (hereinafter in this Act referred to as the

unless the
			 context specifies otherwise) shall establish the Local Food for Healthy
			 Families Program for the purpose of making grants to certain entities to carry
			 out projects to provide incentives to low-income families receiving
			 supplemental nutrition assistance program benefits to purchase fruits and
			 vegetables.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to administer, evaluate, and monitor this Act for such
			 fiscal year.

text.#text:
Not more than 10
			 percent of the funds made available to carry out this Act for a fiscal year may
			 be used by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 convene an advisory committee composed of representatives of organizations that
			 have prior experience implementing local fruit and vegetable incentive programs
			 to advise him on the design of the Local Food for Healthy Families
			 Program.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, to be eligible
			 to receive a grant to carry out a project under this Act, the following
			 entities may submit to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Local Food for Healthy Families Act of 2013/s:3/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
an application that contains such
			 information and assurances, at such time and in such form, as the

text.#text: Subject to

Private nonprofit
			 entities.

Agricultural
			 cooperatives.

Producer networks
			 or associations.

Community health
			 organizations.

Public benefit
			 corporations.

Economic
			 development cooperatives.

Farmers’
			 markets.

Community
			 supported agriculture programs.

Buying
			 clubs.

Retail food
			 stores that participate in the supplemental nutrition assistance
			 program.

State, local, or
			 tribal agencies.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall include an assurance that the applicant
			 will impose on recipients of incentives under this Act the same terms and
			 conditions that apply to purchases made by individuals using supplemental
			 nutrition assistance program benefits.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Local Food for Healthy Families Act of 2013/s:3/ss:a

text.#text:
An application
			 submitted under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Local Food for Healthy Families Act of 2013/s:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall give priority to eligible entities that—

text.#text: In making grants under

are located in
			 underserved communities,

provide locally
			 produced fruits and vegetables,

maximize the share
			 of funds used for direct incentives to participants,

use
			 direct-to-consumer sales marketing,

demonstrate a
			 track record of designing and implementing successful nutrition incentive
			 programs that connect low-income consumers and agricultural producers,

develop innovative
			 linkages between for-profit and nonprofit organizations, and

address other
			 criteria as established by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may be paid with Federal funds.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Local Food for Healthy Families Act of 2013/s:2

text.#text:
Not more than 50
			 percent of the cost of any project for which a grant is made under

An eligible
			 entity that applies for a grant under section 2 shall agree to provide not less
			 than 50 percent of the cost of the project for which application is submitted
			 from non-Federal sources, except that—

an eligible entity
			 that is a nonprofit entity may value in cash or in-kind (fairly evaluated) its
			 share of the cost of such project, and

an eligible entity that is a for-profit
			 entity may value only in cash (and may not include services of an employee,
			 including salaries paid or expenses covered by the employer) its share of the
			 cost of such project.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide for an independent evaluation of each project for which a grant
			 is made under this Act. Such evaluation shall—

text.#text: The

measure the impact
			 of such project on—

improving the nutrition and health status
			 of families that participate in projects carried out under this Act, and

increasing the quantity of fruits and
			 vegetables purchased by such families, and

use rigorous methodologies capable of
			 producing scientifically valid information regarding the effectiveness of such
			 project.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may provide technical assistance regarding the
			 operation of the Local Food for Healthy Families Program to entities that
			 request such information.

text.#text:
In carrying out
			 this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may
			 provide for sharing of information concerning the operation of the Local Food
			 for Healthy Families Program, the operation of projects carried out under such
			 program, and the issues arising from such program and such projects, with and
			 among—

text.#text: The

researchers, practitioners, and other
			 interested persons.

The value of any
			 incentive provided under this Act to a participating family shall not be
			 considered income or resources for any purpose under any Federal, State, or
			 local law.

A grant made available under this Act shall not be used
			 to carry out any project that limits the use of benefits provided under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or any other Federal
			 nutrition law.

text.#text:
Incentives provided under this Act to families that
			 receive supplemental nutrition assistance program benefits shall not—

be considered to
			 be part of such benefits; or

be used in the
			 collection or disposition of claims under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 13 of the Food and Nutrition
			 Act of 2008

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}prop.#text:
to carry out the Local Food for Healthy Families
			 Program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text: $20,000,000 for each of the fiscal years 2014 through 2018

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Out of any funds in the
			 Treasury not otherwise appropriated, the
